channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Target-Date Funds Are Way Too Popular and Boring for These 401(k) Savers
item.description: They are the default choice for millions of retirement savers who are automatically enrolled in 401(k) plans. But some investors are moving out of them.

item.title: My grandfather co-signed my cousin’s student loan. After my grandfather died, my cousin skipped town. Will the estate have to pay the debt?
item.description: “The loan is now in default, and I have no idea where this grandson is.”

item.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Slashes Apple Stake
item.description: The conglomerate sold a net $75.5 billion of stocks—including Apple—in the three months through June, helping boost its cash hoard to a record $276.94 billion.

item.title: Medicare patients could get emergency treatment at home under new bill
item.description: A new proposal in Congress would allow older Medicare recipients to receive emergency medical services at home rather than having to be transported to a hospital for care, which could help them avert potential health and financial consequences resulting from a hospital visit.

item.title: How Investors Can Use Stocks' Moving Averages to Improve Returns
item.description: Moving averages can also smooth out daily volatility to give investors a clearer view of a stock’s health

item.title: You’ll know AI has taken over when we no longer value money
item.description: A future where machines organize, decide and execute all economic activities is no future at all.

item.title: The Fed Is Behind the Curve. There's Still No Need to Panic.
item.description: Instead of blindly selling, investors should eye sectors like real estate that will benefit from lower interest rates.

item.title: Is there a blood test for Alzheimer’s? Yes, but it isn’t at your doctor’s office yet.
item.description: A blood test has greater success than doctors in determining whether someone has memory loss due to Alzheimer’s disease, a new study found.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Contest
item.description: Read about our columnists’ favorite and least-favorite stocks and see how they performed.

item.title: Making billionaires pay more in taxes is only fair — even millionaires want it
item.description: Finance ministers of the G20 nations agree that the ultra-rich should pay their fair share.
